steps.title: The Core of Every Beat
steps.description: The kick and snare are the two most important drums. The kick provides the low-end pulse, while the snare gives the sharp 'crack'. Together, they define the feel and groove of a beat. Let's explore different ways to combine them.

steps.title: Kick Alone
steps.description: Start with just the kick drum. In most beats, the kick falls on beat 1.

steps.title: Snare Alone
steps.description: Now just the snare. The snare typically falls on beats 2 and 4 (the 'backbeat').

steps.title: Kick + Snare Together
steps.description: Play kick and snare at the same time. This powerful combination is used at the climax of fills and transitions.

steps.title: Kick + Clap Combo
steps.description: In many pop and hip-hop beats, the clap layers with or replaces the snare. Play kick and clap together.

steps.title: Snare + Clap Layer
steps.description: Layering snare and clap creates a thicker, more powerful backbeat. Play them together.

steps.title: Backbeat Quiz
